page.title: 18SHIPLEY PARK
page.content: Included in Shipley Park are some of the lodges which once guarded the entrance to Shipley Hall-Nottingham Lodge, Derby Lodge, Mapperley Lodge and Smalley Lodge. One lodge may be made into a museum to show the local history of the Shipley estate and what life was like for the people. Shipley Hall stood on Shipley Hill but owing to coal mining subsidence, it had to be demolished. The foundations have been dug out and the ground floor rooms labelled so it looks like a full scale plan on the grass. Near the site of the Hall, the Water Tower has been repaired. On the ground floor there is a tearoom and from the top there are good views over all the park. Across the lake there is Britannia Park, an area which is being developed to attract more visitors.
